content:
I'd be happy to help you create a content calendar for the next two weeks. Here's a suggested calendar that includes promotional posts for your blog, your regular live streams on YouTube, and some additional content to keep your audience engaged:

**Week 1:**

* Monday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Monday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "Get ready for tonight's live stream! #YouTubeLive #SkincareMakeup"
* Tuesday: Instagram post - "Sneak Peek" (idea #1 from my previous response)
* Wednesday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Wednesday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "Who's ready for tonight's live stream? #YouTubeLive #SkincareMakeup"
* Thursday: TikTok video - "Product Reveal" (idea #1 from my previous response)
* Friday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Friday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "Last live stream of the week! Join me tonight at 8 pm EST #YouTubeLive #SkincareMakeup"

**Week 2:**

* Monday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Monday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "One week until my blog post reveal! Stay tuned for more sneak peeks #SkincareMakeup #BlogPost"
* Tuesday: Instagram post - "Before and After" (idea #2 from my previous response)
* Wednesday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Wednesday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "Two days until my blog post reveal! Get ready for my favorite skincare and makeup products #SkincareMakeup #BlogPost"
* Thursday: TikTok video - "Makeup Tutorial" (idea #3 from my previous response)
* Friday, 8 pm EST: YouTube Live Stream (regular schedule)
* Friday, 7 pm EST (pre-live stream): Instagram post - "Tomorrow's the big day! My blog post is live tomorrow! #SkincareMakeup #BlogPost"
* Saturday: Blog post goes live! Share a final reminder post on Instagram and TikTok, encouraging your audience to check it out.

**Additional Tips:**

* Try to maintain a consistent aesthetic and tone across your Instagram and TikTok posts.
* Use relevant hashtags to reach a wider audience.
* Engage with your audience by responding to comments and answering questions on both platforms.
* Consider sharing behind-the-scenes content or sneak peeks on your Instagram Stories and TikTok Duets to keep your audience engaged.
* Make sure to track your analytics to see what's working and what needs improvement.

This content calendar should help you promote your blog post without overwhelming your audience. Remember to stay flexible and adjust the calendar as needed based on your audience's engagement and feedback. Good luck with your blog post and live streams!
